Sadaf has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan that she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates to fully stock her husband's store. In this way, her husband will be able to meet the increasing demands of customers consistently. She dreams of expanding the business and plans to utilize part of her revenues to meet household expenses. Sadaf thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates for her husband.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is married and lives with her husband and three children in her own home. For the past 10 years, she has been a farmer from Chieb village in the Baray district, Kampong Thom. Chanthou primarily grows rice on a two-hectare farm to earn a living. Her husband shares the responsibilities to the family by raising animals and fishing.

Chanthou is requesting a 4,000,000 KHR loan to buy two cows to fatten. Her husband will sell them for a profit after two or three months. Chanthou’s loan will allow her husband to sustain their business and make a consistent income. She thanks lenders for contributing their funds towards a poor fellow like her.

loans.use: to buy two cows to fatten and sell

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en:
Joaninha is married. She runs a general store to help generate income for her family. Joaninha opened her store in 2009 with her own working capital of 600 USD.

Joaninha is requesting a 1,500 USD loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as Sprite, beer, bread, cigarettes, and shampoo, along with a refrigerator. She is a hardworking woman who hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Joaninha is happy for this loan that is offered to poor people to improve their future living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beer, bread, cigarettes, shampoo, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (one orphan). She has a medical clinic business. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of tablets, syringes, and syrups. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. She works in a shop six days out of every week and sells on both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenge includes defaulters and thieves. She aspires to own a fully stocked clinic and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but lacks access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of syrup, syringes, and tablets.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Fanny, quien con su credikiva compró productos como perfumes, desodorantes y cremas , los cuales llegaron en su catálogo, con precios excepcionales , ella logró venderlos, dando un plazo a su clientela mucho más amplio para pagarle sus compras a crédito, pues contaba con un capital adicional, gracias a  su credikiva- .   Fanny se encuentra más animada y con mucho mas deseos de continuar fortaleciendo su negocio, pues le ha suministrado muy buenas utilidades. Por eso dice a sus financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por su apoyo, que Dios los bendiga y los guarde y que sigan apoyando a más mujeres “. En la actualidad está aplicando a una nueva financiación, para comprar nuevos productos, como perfumería y artículos de aseo personal, pues las promociones de fin de año aumentaron y ella necesita aprovecharlas, para complacer a su clientela y obtener una vez más, ganancias en su negocio y este es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Fanny, who bought catalogue products at exceptional prices with her Kiva loan: perfume, deodorant, and lotion.  She was able to sell them and, with the additional capital, give her customers longer deadlines to pay on credit.

Thanks to her Kiva loan Fanny is more full of life and has a much greater desire to continue strengthening her business because it has given her very good profits.  This is why she says to her Kiva lenders: "Thank you for your help.  May God bless and take care of you, and may you continue to help more women."

Currently Fanny's applying for another loan to buy new products such as perfume and personal care products.  The end-of-year specials have expanded and she needs to make the most of them to satisfy her customers and earn profits once again.  This is what's successful about her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy perfume and personal care products

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is a 56-year-old farmer who hails from the rural area of Kisii. She is an established farmer who has done this work for 24 years. On her farm, she rears dairy cows and poultry. She also grows tea and other crops that she sells in the area. She enjoys farming, because as she says, it's a source of income for her. The major challenges she faces in this work are lack of good markets and poor roads. Philomena says that Juhudi loans are the best, because they have low interest rates. This loan will help her purchase a dairy cow, which will add more income and hence better her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lilliam Magdaly

texts.es: Lilliam Magdaly mayor de edad casada con tres hijos menores de edad, originaria de Chinandega lugar ubicado en el occidente del país, Lilliam se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable, trabajadora, honesta y con muchos deseos de superación personal, desafortunadamente no pudo terminar sus estudios por falta de recursos económico en su hogar por lo que se vio obligada a trabajar desde muy joven aprendiendo el negocio que hoy en día es propio de ella. Lilliam es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa, cosméticos, zapatos, prendas de oro, plata y bronce. Su jornada de trabajo empieza desde muy temprano las cuales realiza unas 10 horas diarias, su negocio es de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, uno de sus sueños es poder algún dia comprar su propia casa y ver a sus realizados todos unos profesionales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería como: ropa, cosméticos, calzados debido a que tiene varios encargos aprovechando que se aproxima la navidad por lo que tiene la oportunidad de obtener mayores ingreso.-
texts.en:
Lilliam Magdaly is married and has three children. She is a native of Chinandega which is located in the west of the country. Lilliam is a responsible, hard-working and honest person with much desire for personal improvement. Unfortunately she could not complete her studies due to a lack of financial resources in her home. As a result she was forced to to work at a very young age learning the trade that today is her own.

Lilliam is a micro entrepreneur who sells general merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, clothing, cosmetics, shoes gold, silver and bronze jewelery. Her work day starts very early and she works 10 hours a day. She does her business door to door and  from her home. One of her dreams is to one day be able to buy her own home and see her children become professionals. 

The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling merchandise like clothing, cosmetics and shoes. She has a variety of orders and wants to take advantage of the coming holiday season with it's opportunities to make more revenue.

loans.use: to invest in buying and selling merchandise like clothing, cosmetics, shoes and gold, silver and bronze jewellery.

loans.name: Ioseb

texts.en:
Ioseb is from the small town of Gori. He is 44 years old and married with three children. Ioseb also cares for his father who is in his seventies. The only income source for the family is a small monthly salary earned by Ioseb’s wife who works as a teacher at the local nursery school. Ioseb’s elder children are university students and they need to pay tuition fees. Ioseb has recently sold his own agricultural land and renovated the second floor of his old house to rent out. 

Now Ioseb is requesting a loan to purchase furniture and appliances. He will furnish his house and plans to rent it out to foreigners at a good price. This initiative will increase his family's income and Ioseb will be able to give his children a good education.  He hopes Kiva lenders will help his family.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and appliances to furnish his house and rent it out

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
Hai was born in 1962. She lives with her family in Dong Anh, Hanoi. She has two sons; one of them is a worker and the other is a student. Hai is a building materials retailer and her husband is a construction worker. She earns about 5,000,000 VND per month and has done this job for 12 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is lack of capital for her building materials business. Her dream is to grow her business and gain more benefits to ensure her family’s livelihood. This loan is one step that will help her achieve this dream. 

Hai is a hard working and creative woman who has a passion for her job. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 11,554,000 VND to buy building materials for retail. She always wants to expand her business and have a better life in the future. 

Other members who are part of Hai's group include the following: Thanh is 60 years old. She has two children. She has been retired for 5 years and wants to borrow 10,682,000 to repair her house. Mo is 62 years old and has two sons. She has retired and sells mechanical materials to earn a living. She wants to borrow 11,554,000 VND to buy mechanical materials to sell. Chien is 57 years old and has two children. She has retired and sells food and drink to earn a living. She wants to borrow 11,554,000 VND to buy food and other materials to sell. Ha is 41 years old and has one child. She has a drug store, which is her family's main source of income. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy building materials for retail.

loans.name: Bon's Group

texts.en:
Bon was born in 1966. She lives with her family in Bac Ninh. She has a son and a daughter. Her son is a driver and her daughter is a worker. Her husband is dead. She leases vans and sells insurance products to earn a living. She has done this job for 4 years. She earns about 7,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 12,000,000 VND per month. Her challenges in life and work are lack of capital to buy vans to rent and competition in the insurance products market. Her dream is to have more capital to focus on her van leasing business and to have a better life in the future. This loan is one step that can help her achieve this dream. 

Bon is a hard working and careful woman. She also has a passion for her business. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy vans to rent. She always wants to develop her business, repair her house, and improve her life in the future.

Other members who are part of Bon’s group include the following: Anh is 46 years old. She has two children. She sells food and drinks to earn a living. She wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to sell food and drinks. Thoa is 42 years old. She has two children. She sells beer to earn a living. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to to sell beer. Lan is 53 years old. She has four children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy materials for crusting.

loans.use: to buy vans to rent.

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en:
Sobir is hardworking man. He is married with two children. Being a responsible father, Sobir works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs and send his children to school.  He is dedicated to the farming business, growing rice on his own land. In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards he has worked hard from early morning till late evening for more than 23 years.

Sobir would like to develop his business, which is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. He hopes that Kiva lenders won’t reject his loan and he thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo Walter pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas.
Por iniciativa propia, Walter trabaja como gestor de cobranza en una empresa recaudadora de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Walter se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea desea reforzar el techado y ponerle piso a una habitación, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Walter is a single 22 year old man. He lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is very hard-working and enthusiastic and has a strong desire to get ahead. Thanks to his own efforts he was able to study to be a Systems Engineer. 

Through his own initiative he works as a collection manager in a collection agency in his city. He works 10 hours a day and feels that things are going well due to his dedication and good performance.

Walter is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their assistance he can make improvements to his house. He wants to reinforce the roof and to floor in one of the rooms. Then he can continue to work and strive to achieve his dream, which is to become a great professional.

loans.use: to make improvements on his house.

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es:
Rosa Matilde tiene 60 años de edad, vive en el distrito de La Matanza donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y cultivo de arroz, esta comunidad pertenece a Morropon, que está ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos,desde hace 2 años Rosa Matilde ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos para comprar alimentos balanceados para los mismos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción lo que le gereran ingresos adicionales para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Matilde is 60 years old. She lives in  the district of La Matanza, which belongs to Morropon, located in the Piura region on Peru's North Coast. The people here work raising small animals and growing rice.

Rosa Matilde has been raising and selling pigs for the past two years. She has requested a loan of 500 PEN to buy balanced feed for her pigs. In this way she can raise her production and generate more income to have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is an established farmer in Kisii, where she has done this work for 35 years. On her farm she rears dairy cows, poultry, and grows tea and other crops. She loves farming because it has been a source of income for her.

Esther chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it offers low interest loans. During the training sessions she learned how to prepare and keep good records. This loan will help her purchase a dairy cow, which will bring in more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Garegin

texts.en: Garegin is an experienced agronomist from Lernadzor village of Syuniq region. He lives with his wife, his 17-year-old daughter, 16-year-old son and his mother. He works in the government sector and his wife works in the village school. They work hard to be able to earn a living for the family. Their salaries, however, are so low that they need alternative sources of income to afford a living. To meet the daily needs of his family, Garegin is engaged in beekeeping. The latter is an important source of the family's income. He sells the honey in the local market and has a high demand there. To continue beekeeping in a sustainable way, Garegin needs to expand it a little bit. He needs a loan of USD 1500 to purchase new beehives. Garegin and his family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness

loans.use: to purchase new beehives

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is helping her husband, operating their own farm of rice to make a living. She has been planting and harvesting rice for fifteen years. By doing this, she has been able to provide for her family's daily needs. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan, which she will use to purchase fertilizer to improve their rice production. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice plants

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is the married father of four children, between the ages of 8 months and 15 years old. Three of them are currently attending school. They all live in an Ashkalali community in Kosovo where he owns a small food market together with his wife, who sometimes helps him when she has free time away from taking care of the children and home. At this time he is requesting a loan in order to purchase foodstuff for his market. He really enjoys what he does and he hopes to gather enough capital to expand it. Ali is very happy for the financial support that this loan will give him, because this way he is certain of making progress in his work. Knowing that it is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff for his market

loans.name: Rosa Adela

texts.es:
Rosa Adela tiene 55 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica al comercio, cultivo de arroz, y ganadería a dos horas de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Desde hace dos años tiene una pequeña bodeguita donde ofrece venta de plásticos y abarrotes su negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar golosinas, frutas y verduras y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa  Adela is 55 years old. She lives with her family in the district of Buenos Aires, two hours from Morropon, part of the Piura Region on Peru's North Coast. The people here are in business, grow rice and raise livestock.

Rosa Adela has operated a small store for the past two years where she offers plastic goods and groceries for sale. Her business is located in her home. She has requested a loan of 1500 PEN to buy candy, fruit and vegetables. In this way she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa is married and has children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives). She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills. She has a business, selling charcoal. She has been in this business for nine years.

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO.  She will use this amount to buy more bags of charcoal.  She generates additional income through selling green banana fingers. She works at the market seven days out of every week, selling on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van, to ease the transportation issues.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Adela tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo en Cayaltí, una zona donde se dedican al cultivo de caña, arroz, comercio de animales menores a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, gallinas, patos, cerdos, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños y posteriormente ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes esto le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Adela is 45 years old. She lives with her husband in Cayaltí, two hours from Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. The people here grow sugar cane, rice and raise small animals.

Together with her family Rosa Adela raises small animals like ducks, chickens and pigs. Her business is located behind her house. She has requested a loan of 700 PEN to buy small animals and later offer them for sale at a higher price. This will generate more revenue for her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Arturo Abraham

texts.es:
Arturo es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Arturo se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Derecho.
Por iniciativa propia, Arturo trabaja en una empresa de recaudación de impuestos de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Arturo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para realizar sus labores pendientes del trabajo, así pues Arturo seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Arturo is 20 years old and single. He lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings. Arturo is described as a very hard-working and energetic person, who has a strong desire to better himself. Thanks to the help of his parents, Arturo is currently pursuing a university degree in law.

Arturo works for a company that collects taxes for the city. He works every day for approximately ten hours, and he thinks that he does well because he is dedicated and does a good job.

Arturo will use this loan to buy a computer, which he says will help him a lot to complete unfinished projects at work. Arturo says that he is grateful to Kiva lenders and that he will continue working and striving to realize his dream to become a distinguished professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Cristo Nos Ama Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cristo nos Ama, está conformado por doce integrantes, once mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Que luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, y bríndales tiempo en familia. Estas personas por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar una carrera, y lucha por sus hijos y brindarles mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.

Gracia a su esfuerzo  y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Dominga y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: pan, leche, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, detergente, jabón, huevos, crema, frutas, hielos, tiste, fósforos.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano p pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Cristo no Ama agradece la ayuda que  los inversionistas kiva les brinda a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Cristo nos Ama” is made up of twelve members, 11 women and 1 man. They are all parents with 20 children between them to care for. They come from Leon, which is in the western part of Nicaragua. They are hard-working, responsible people who want to move ahead in life. They fight daily for a better future for their children. In their spare time, they like to enjoy the company of their children and to spend time as a family. These are people who were unable to study for a career because of a lack of economic resources, but they strive to be able to offer better opportunities for their children.

The co-ordinator of the group is Dominga, thanks to her drive and her desire to get on in life. Her economic activity is a neighbourhood grocery store. This is a small shop that sells supplies such as bread, milk, sugar, beans, oil, detergent, soap, eggs, cream, fruit, ice-creams, "tiste" (a powdered drink made of cornmeal and cocoa powder) and matches. She works 12 hours a day at her business, selling her products. She needs a loan to invest in working capital to stock-up her business buying and selling groceries, so that in the near future she can earn a higher income. The "Crista nos Ama" communal bank thanks Kiva lenders for providing poor people, and poor countries such as Nicaragua, with the opportunity to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock-up her grocery store by buying and selling products such as bread, milk, sugar, beans, oil, detergent, soap, eggs, cream, fruit, ice-cream, tiste (a powdered drink) and matches.

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien was born in 1983. She lives with her family in Bac Ninh. She has three children. Her oldest child is in primary school, and the others are in kindergarten. Her husband is a carpenter, and so is she. She has done this work for six years. She also sells fruit, to earn a living. Lien is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She also has passion in her business. She said that it’s a flexible job, and she has more time to take care of her children. She earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total income is about 7,000,000 VND per month.

Her challenge in life and work is a lack of capital to buy materials for finishing wood (such as lacquer), and a lack of money to pay for her children’s education. Her dream is to have more capital, with which to buy finishing materials. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach for this dream. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,152,000 VND, and use it to buy materials for finishing. She always wants to develop her business, open a woodshop, and save profit for her children’s education.

The other member of Lien’s group for this loan is Hue, 21 years old. She has a child. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND. She will use her share of this loan to buy materials for carpentry work.

loans.use: to buy materials for finishing wood.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is married and has three children. She helps her husband in their farm, to make a living. She raises pigs for sale, while her husband grows and harvests coconut and bananas, selling them in town. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC, which she will use to repair the livestock shelter. In the future, Elina wants to see her children successful.

loans.use: to repair the livestock shelter

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos Puquijaca, una zona rural de San Felipe, un distrito que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y cultivo de lima a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que se ubica en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedican a la distribución de cerveza, gas y combustible, Karina ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para invertir en una bodega con la compra de abarrotes, arroz, leche, azúcar, menestras y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Karina is 33 years old and lives with her husband and children in Piquijaca, a rural area of San Felipe, a district characterized by its hot climate and lime growing. It is two hours from the city of Jaen, which is located in the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountains of Peru. 

She and her husband work distributing beer, gas, and fuel. Karina has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 PEN to invest in a small grocery store by buying groceries, rice, milk, sugar, and dried vegetables. In this way she will be able to make a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries, rice, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Pajtim

texts.en:
Pajtim wants to thank all the lenders for the previous loan, which helped him to buy new working tools for his business and thereby improve his living standards and ensure income for his family. 

He is still in his business of installing air-conditioners.  Recently he opened a shop for electrical services and repairs, and he is in need of a loan to purchase more equipment for an air conditioner and to buy electrician tools. He hopes in the future to expand his business more and increase his income. 

He wants to thank all of the lenders for the second loan; he appreciates all of the lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more equipment for an air conditioner and to buy electrician tools
